title: Want to Cut Down Your Screen Time? We Put One Trendy Strategy to the Test
sub_head: Some tech experts recommend switching your screen to grayscale to curb a doomscrolling habit. It (sort of) worked.
body:
I WAS INTRIGUED when, in a recent interview, Grammy-winning musician Lorde revealed the simple trick she uses to resist the kaleidoscopic temptations of her smartphone: adjusting her settings to switch to a grayscale-only display. Could a bleaker screen curb my own digital dependency, a habit the pandemic has only exacerbated?
“Anything that makes your phone less of a shiny treasure helps,” said Devorah Heitner, author of “Screenwise: Helping Kids Thrive (and Survive) in Their Digital World,” explaining that, for many, a more stagnant existence in the Covid era made it harder to resist the stimulation of devices.
